did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center.
did.abstract: The collection consists of one manuscript, a Junior honors project, completed by Ms. Fallows for the Sociology/Anthropolgy Department at Wellesley College in 1947. The manuscript documents the early ethnic history of Granby, Connecticut and the reactions of the long-time residents to the arrival and assimilation of several ethnic groups.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Ms. Marjorie Fallows attended Wellesley College and resided in Bass River, Massachusetts, at the time of the collection donation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of one manuscript, a Junior honors project, completed by Ms. Fallows for the Sociology/Anthropolgy Department at Wellesley College in 1947. The manuscript documents the early ethnic history of Granby, Connecticut and the reactions of the long-time residents to the arrival and assimilation of several ethnic groups.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to Connecticut's ethnic communities. See especially, the Center for Oral History's Peoples of Connecticut Project. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.
